Hi Sachin,

On 11/15/05, sachin.dholakia@... <sachin.dholakia@...> =
wrote:
>
> Hi J.B,
>
> I am on the other side of the shore and believe in C=
ode coverage and so
> very interested in knowing why you feel that 100% cod=
e coverage isn't a
> requirement for code check in?  Can you please share y=
our thoughts?


Nobody disputes that 100% code coverage is a good thing, it=
's just that it
becomes impossibly hard to achieve as your code base become=
s more complex.
You just need to make sure you don't hit the point of dimin=
ishing return
when trying to hit a balance between "more code coverage", "m=
ore tests",
"bug fixes" and "more features".

--
C=E9dric
http://testng.org=
